alert.note: Alert for Columbia; Lincoln; McDuffie (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 30 at 5:49AM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern McDuffie, northwestern Columbia, Lincoln and McCormick Counties through 630 AM EST... At 548 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Lowndesville to near Bobby Brown State Park to near Crawfordville. Movement was east at 65 mph. ...Boaters on Lake Strom Thurmond Should Seek Safe Harbor... HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... McCormick, Lincolnton, Clarks Hill Recreation Area, Elijah Clark State Park, Mistletoe State Park, Wrightsboro, Hamilton Branch State Park, J. Strom Thurmond Dam, Mccormick County Airport, Lake Strom Thurmond, Bobby Brown State Park, Parksville, Plum Branch, Bordeaux, Scott`s Landing, Knox Scout Reservation, Double Branches, Wildwood Park, New Hope and Long Cane Creek Picnic Area. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If on or near Lake Thurmond, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.
